definitions.definition: a person who is in charge of other people at work and tells them what to do

examples.text: I'll ask my boss if I can have the day off.
I like being **my own boss** *(= working for myself and making my own decisions)*.
Who's the boss *(= who's in control)* in this house?
He thinks he's impressing the boss by working through lunch.
He accused his former boss of being arrogant.

definitions.definition: a person who is in charge of a large organization

examples.text: Hospital bosses protested at the decision.
Council bosses have agreed to meet a handful of homeowners today.
The Renault team boss later apologized for his comments.
There's been criticism of bonuses paid to top oil company bosses.

definitions.definition: to make it clear to somebody that you have more power and authority than they have

wordOrigin: early 19th cent. (originally US): from Dutch baas ‘master’.
